user_query: powerful. I didn't feel that way in the end of Interstellar. They wanted me to but I just felt like wow this is really well directed and I wish that I was feeling like I cared more in this moment. No, I don't want to come off like I didn't like this movie because for goodness sakes I did. This is going to be a day one Blu-ray purchase for me. I'm going to go to Walmart Monday at midnight and have him dig it out of the box. I can't wait to see the film in digital clarity because I just saw it in 35mm film with not the greatest sound but I really did enjoy this movie. I have to praise its ambitiousness because it really has a lot of huge ideas and it was kind of like Nolan just threw himself at the mercy of everyone just like look this is what I want to do, here's all of it, just blow out like a gigantic vomit of ideas and he just put it all out there. Some of it doesn't work and some of it really does but the stuff that does really does. There are moments of brilliance in this movie. There are long stretches where my eyes were glued. There were moments when my mouth dropped. I got goosebumps at a couple parts. I had to pee like the last 90 minutes of this movie and I didn't get up. I was so into it that it kind of eclipses my qualms with the way the film concluded and even though I wanted a little more ambiguity from the way the film ended in more of an emotional punch to the film, I still was so entertained by everything that came before that.
